Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of MIRTH: A Novel Catheter-Based Intramyocardial Ventricular Remodeling Procedure

Trial_Design.evidence: Animals were randomly assigned to receive MIRTH or serve as controls.

Participants.evidence: juvenile Yorkshire swine with healthy myocardium or ischemic cardiomyopathy

Intervention.evidence: Animals were randomly assigned to receive MIRTH or serve as controls.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the change in left ventricular performance, measured by contractility and mechanical efficiency, over a 90-day period.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was achieved using a computer-generated sequence, and allocation was concealed using sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was not applicable due to the nature of the intervention.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 33 animals were randomised: 17 with healthy myocardium and 16 with ischemic cardiomyopathy.

Result_Outcome.evidence: MIRTH significantly improved left ventricular performance in cardiomyopathic animals, with increased contractility and mechanical efficiency (p < 0.05).

Harms.evidence: No adverse events related to myocardial erosion were observed.

Funding.evidence: Supported by the Division of Intramural Research, National Heart Lung and Blood Institute, National Institutes of Health USA (grant Z01-HL006040).
